@metadata.goal: The student can partition shapes into equal parts

steps.dialogue: Now shade one part to show what gets packaged.

step.dialogue: Almost. Shade just one of the two parts.

events.name: outline_single_section
events.description: One piece of the bar is outlined with a pulsing border to indicate which section should be shaded

step.dialogue: [event:outline_single_section]You're getting there. Here's a hint - you only need to shade one piece of the bar, not both pieces.

events.name: animated_shading_single_section
events.description: Animated demonstration showing one section of the bar gradually filling with shading while the other section remains unshaded, with an annotation indicating '1 out of 2 parts'

step.dialogue: [event:animated_shading_single_section]Let me help you with this one. To show what gets packaged, we shade just one of the two parts. Watch as I shade this section here - now [fraction numerator=1 denominator=2]one half[/fraction] is shaded. There we go - [fraction numerator=1 denominator=2]one half[/fraction] is 1 out of 2 equal sections.

on_correct.dialogue: You shaded [fraction numerator=1 denominator=2]one half[/fraction] of the bar.
